summary: Dr. James K. Lightfoot, Jr., M.D. was found guilty of unprofessional conduct for treating a patient with whom he had a close personal and financial relationship, including prescribing Controlled Dangerous Substances (CDS) without proper documentation or disclosure of the conflict of interest. The Maryland State Board of Physicians issued a reprimand, a 5-day license suspension, one year of probation with enrollment in a rehabilitation program and a professional boundaries course, and a $10,000 civil fine.
